metadata.title: CVE-2017-11636 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - medium.
metadata.description: GraphicsMagick 1.3.26 has a heap overflow in the WriteRGBImage() function in coders/rgb.c when processing multiple frames that have non-identical widths. It was discovered that GraphicsMagick incorrectly handled certain image files. An attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service or other unspecified impact.

criterions.comment: graphicsmagick package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.3.26-4').
